channel.title: Ramah: Good News Feed
channel.description: Positive news stories from around the world, filtered by sentiment analysis

item.title: Julian Barnes on his last novel: 'I hope it's a good one to go out on'
item.description: Julian Barnes is sitting at an ancient electric typewriter in his study in north London.

item.title: Sex, drugs and sugar babies: first trailer for Euphoria season three drops
item.description: The first trailer for the third season of Euphoria promises more sex, drugs and violence, teasing a troubled life after high school for the show’s characters.

item.title: Gemini can now scan your photos, email, and more to provide better answers
item.description: The feature will start with paid users only, and it’s off by default.

item.title: Amateur stuns pros to win One Point Slam and A$1m in boost for Australian Open
item.description: A 29-year-old tennis coach from Sydney won the inaugural One Point Slam at the Australian Open and its A$1m prize on Wednesday, after upstaging a field which included Jannik Sinner, Carlos Alcaraz, Iga Swiatek and Coco Gauff.

item.title: Yodellers, bathing monkeys and a ballroom clean: photos of the day – Wednesday
item.description: The Guardian’s picture editors select photographs from around the world Continue reading.

item.title: Bafta names rising stars who are tipped for film success
item.description: The nominees for Bafta's Rising Star award have been announced, shining a spotlight on some of the film industry's most exciting up-and-coming acting talent.

item.title: Welsh wind farms win funding with up to 7,000 jobs expected
item.description: Two wind farms off the west and north Wales coastline have secured UK government funding to supply the national grid, with up to 7,000 jobs expected to be created.

item.title: Pole to Pole With Will Smith review – every single moment is gorgeous or thrilling
item.description: Hollywood stars – they’re just like us! Except that when we want to go on a massive jolly/rehabilitative journey for ourselves and/or our careers, we have to pay for it.

item.title: Offshore windfarm contracts to fuel 12m homes in Great Britain after record auction
item.description: A make-or-break auction for the UK government’s goal to create a clean electricity system by 2030 has awarded subsidy contracts to enough offshore windfarms to power a record 12m homes.

item.title: Wildcard Preston makes maiden quarters with upset win
item.description: Taylah Preston has progressed to her first top-level quarterfinal after upsetting Rebecca Šramková in straight sets at the Hobart International.

item.title: Emma Raducanu recovers in Hobart to post first win in over three months
item.description: Emma Raducanu offered an impressive demonstration of her resilience at the Hobart International as she rallied from an overnight second-set deficit in her rain-delayed first-round match to defeat Camila Osorio of Colombia 6-3, 7-6 (2).

item.title: US approves sale of Nvidia's advanced H200 chips to China
item.description: The US government has given chip giant Nvidia the green light to sell its advanced artificial intelligence (AI) processors in China, the Department of Commerce said on Tuesday.

item.title: 'Welcome to 2976' - North Africa's Amazigh people ring in the new year
item.description: Across North Africa, the Amazigh people have been coming together to usher in the year 2976.

item.title: Why you're more like the Traitors than you think
item.description: From small social excuses to deliberate deceptions, lying is something most of us do, often without stopping to think about why.

item.description: Rukmini Iyer’s recipe contains a microwave method for cooking rice, but I’ve successfully made basmati in a rice cooker countless times – just pop the whole garlic clove in with the rice grains.

item.title: Jellyfish sleep and nap like us. Studying them could help human brains
item.description: A new study analyzed the sleep patterns of jellyfish and sea anemones and found they share some sleep traits with humans.

item.description: It’s very rare for a fourquel to be the best film in a franchise, but that’s how things stand with the chequered 28 Days Later series.

item.description: If you're feeling concerned about microplastics it can be hard to know what to do about it.
